603 [[Kilohertz|kHz]] [[amplitude modulation|AM]] |Charleville |area = Central West Queensland, South West Queensland and some areas of the Gulf and other remote Queensland| |owner = [[Australian Broadcasting Corporation]] | |format = [[Talk radio|Talk]] | |website = [http://www.abc.net.au/westqld/ http://www.abc.net.au/westqld/] | }} '''ABC Western Queensland ''' is an [[ABC Local Radio]] station based in [[Longreach, Queensland|Longreach]] broadcasting to the [[Regions of Queensland|Central West, South West and Gulf regions]] of [[Queensland]]. It covers a wide area stretching as far as the towns of [[Charleville, Queensland|Charleville]], [[Winton Queensland|Winton]] and [[Birdsville, Queensland|Birdsville]]. The station began broadcasting as '''4QL''' in 1947 on 690 AM, originally as a relay of the national program. Studios were then built and local programs began in 1952. ABC Western Queensland now broadcasts through the following main [[AM Broadcasting|AM]] transmitters along with a number of low power FM repeaters: *'''4QL''' 540 AM *'''4CH''' 603 AM During the late 1980s the NERR (North East Regional Radio) satellite service was established. This allowed 'black spots' to be filled in, supplementing the Longreach and Charleville transmitters.
